title: Mezzanine: a brief primer
description:
Mezzanine is a CMS framework built on top of Django that provides a set
of primitives for building rich sites that can be managed by
non-technical users.

Topics this talk will cover:

-  Where Mezzanine sits in the broader ecosystem. Mezzanine is not a
   stand-alone product like Drupal or Wordpress, but a set of tools.
   There are other tools associated with Mezzanine that provide
   functionality that Mezzanine itself doesn't provide
-  Structure of a Mezzanine site
-  Two techniques for managing content Page-based vs object-based;
   example and use-cases
-  Things Mezzanine does well Advantages of using Mezzanine over other
   CMS systems
-  Things Mezzanine does not do well Reasons not to use Mezzanine
